author: Staff Reporter
text:
Urur Olcott Kuppam, a small fishing village in Besant Nagar, will play host to varied art forms ranging from Kuyilattam to Bharatanatyam and rock music performances this weekend.

“Many do not know about our fishing village and our rich art and culture. We hope to put that on show for the people,” K. Saravanan, an office-bearer of the Urur Kuppam Fisher Welfare Cooperative said, speaking about the Urur Olcott Kuppam Vizha that has been scheduled for Saturday and Sunday.

There are many misconceptions about the fishing community, Mr Saravanan said, and he hoped it would go away with more people coming to the area to see the cultural festival. “Apart from Thappattam, Paraiattam and Oyilattam performances which we have lined up, many of our children too have begun to learn Bharatanatyam and will be showcasing it as well,” he added.Equal platform

Speaking about the festival, T.M. Krishna, Carnatic musician and a volunteer organiser, said the aim behind organising such a festival was to give an equal platform for varied arts to come together and for people from different spheres to enjoy them.

“No specific performing space or art should be put above others. In the lead-up to this festival, we have had three mini-fests with performances as well as a programme at the Ayodhya Mandapam in West Mambalam where we honoured the fisherfolk who had helped Chennai during the floods,” he said.

On February 27 and 28, Villupaatu, Paraiattam, and nagaswaram programmes as well as music concerts by Raghu Dixit and Sean Roaldan and a Bharatanatyam performance by Sheejith Krishna will take place as a part of the festival.
title: A melange of art, culture on sands of Besant Nagar
